if  the filesystem is some how currupted. it will get mounted read only. You proberly need to 'fsck' it first and fix any errors with the filesystem first.
it was working fine not 10 minutes ago, and I know its the xorg, cause it tells me that X11 cant start up, but when I go to mod xorg.conf, it doesnt save, stating that its a read only fs

if a filesystem some how triggers an error - the system will 'remount' it as read only to pervent data curruption.. this can happen '10 min ago' or at any time..chedk dmesg logs.. and i would strongly suggest booting a live cd and manyually fscking the filesystem. xorg.conf changes will not affect the filesystem. :)
assuming this is a normal install and not some live-cd you are running from now.. at least. :)
